title.rendered: San Antonio AC Repair: 5 Tips to Tell if Your AC Needs a Tune-Up

content.rendered:
A wise philosopher once said that prevention is better than cure. This is one of those time-tested adages that’s true for a lot of things, especially home maintenance! Regular San Antonio AC repair and tune-ups are critical to ensure your AC runs smoothly. If your air conditioner is acting strange, you know you have failed to run routine maintenance. In this post, we are going to discuss some common signs that indicate an AC tune-up is long overdue.

5 Signs You Need To Call San Antonio AC Repair 

Increased levels of humidity in the room

San Antonio is no stranger to humidity. Even though we are quite famous (infamous?) for sticky weather, it doesn’t mean you have to experience humidity inside your home too. A well-functioning air conditioner automatically takes care of the humidity indoors.

But if you feel higher levels of humidity inside, it’s another sign that a tune-up must be scheduled. Contact a San Antonio AC repair professional to check whether the humidity is due to low refrigerant levels, damaged evaporator coil, or something else.

Strange sounds

If your air conditioner is old, you must have become used to the noises it usually makes. But if you notice any new sounds, such as buzzing, hissing, or clanking, there might be a new issue with the unit.

Generally, when an AC makes a buzzing sound, it means the airflow is getting hindered as the unit tries to push the air past the obstruction. A raspy or humming noise means the blades inside the unit have become damaged and are not moving properly. 

We recommend calling a San Antonio AC repair professional to get to the root of the problem before it gets worse (and expensive to repair).

Not enough cool air

If your air conditioner is blowing out warm or hot air, then something is obviously wrong with it. This could happen for a number of reasons, all of which can be addressed during a routine tune-up.

The air filter may need to be replaced or the AC coil may need to be cleaned to prevent dust from impacting the airflow. There could also be a lack of enough refrigerant. Call a San Antonio AC repair company to evaluate the issue and get it fixed right away.

Higher than usual cooling bills

If you are using your AC for the same duration you have been using it for years, but the utility bills have significantly increased, it could mean your AC is consuming more energy now.

This often happens due to a lack of maintenance or if the unit is very old. As the system gets older, it starts to lose efficiency unless you schedule regular AC inspections and tune-ups. Over time, the unit may need to work harder due to the accumulation of dust, dirt, debris, etc. This means it will use more energy than it should.

Foul smells

If you feel that your air conditioner is emitting bad odors, please call a San Antonio AC repair as soon as possible before the problem gets worse. The smell can be a result of blocked drain lines, wet filters, dead critters, or mold buildup. 

Call Us For Same-Day AC Repair and Maintenance in San Antonio

If your air conditioner needs some TLC, it’s best to rely on licensed and experienced professionals. At United Home Services, our HVAC technicians can perform regular AC tune-up to ensure your system runs smoothly for years to come. Talk to us at 866-836-2341 today or contact us online to schedule an appointment.
